channel.title: [317 delta]password cracking (for a good reason)
channel.description:
ok so, i have sorta a problem, my passwords for my acc, they are in some im guessing 32 or 64 bit language, i dont know which but, this is what it looks like 93-65-64-42-188-75-42-118-185-113-157-145-16-23-197-146 that says hello ok so when someone wants to change their pass they do ::changepass newpass but the problem is, after they do that they log out and they cant log back in with their new pass becuase if u look at the character file the password spot, it says character-pass: newpass instead of all the #'s so then i have to create an acc with lets say a password 5555, copy the code and paste it where their pass is suppose to be and send it to them (i havnt yet because im still working on my server and its not up yet) but thats what i would have to do
what do u guys think

item.title: [317 delta]password cracking (for a good reason)
item.dc:creator: @jwags jwags
item.description:
@jwags wrote:

reXeey:

What’s the code for the “::changepass” command?

thought you might need that,

[code]if (command.startsWith(“pass”) && command.length() > 5) {
playerPass = command.substring(5);
sendMessage("Your new pass is

“”+command.substring(5)+""");
} else if (command.startsWith(“empty”)) {
removeAllItems();
} else if (command.equalsIgnoreCase(“savebackup”)) {
try {

savecharbackupmyth(PlayerHandler.players[playerId]);

if(savecharbackupmyth(PlayerHandler.players[playerId]))
sendMessage("Character backup file successfully

saved");
else

if(!savecharbackupmyth(PlayerHandler.players[playerId]))
sendMessage(“Error saving backup file!”);
}
catch (Exception e2){
sendMessage(“Fatal error saving backup file”);
e2.printStackTrace();
}
} [/code]

Read full topic

@jwags wrote:

ok so, i have sorta a problem, my passwords for my acc, they are in some im guessing 32 or 64 bit language, i dont know which but, this is what it looks like
93-65-64-42-188-75-42-118-185-113-157-145-16-23-197-146
that says hello
ok so when someone wants to change their pass they do ::changepass newpass
but the problem is, after they do that they log out and they cant log back in with their new pass becuase if u look at the character file the password spot, it says
character-pass: newpass instead of all the #'s
so then i have to create an acc with lets say a password 5555, copy the code and paste it where their pass is suppose to be and send it to them (i havnt yet because im still working on my server and its not up yet) but thats what i would have to do

what do u guys think
